case_title: PATCHALA SEETHARAMAIAH vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX and another

accussed_details.name: PATCHALA SEETHARAMAIAH
allegation: Failure to comply with payment deadline under Voluntary Disclosure of Income Scheme, 1997

complaint_summary: Petitioner sought refund of Rs.23,281 paid under Voluntary Disclosure of Income Scheme, 1997, due to delayed payment rendering the declaration void.
investigation_summary: Petitioner filed a declaration under the scheme on December 27, 1997, disclosing income for 1991-92 and 1992-93. Tax payment was delayed by one day beyond the prescribed three-month period, leading to denial of certificate issuance and refund request.
judgment_summary: The court ruled that the retention of tax paid under a void declaration is unconstitutional under Article 265 of the Constitution. Section 70 of the scheme does not apply to void declarations. The petitioner is entitled to a refund of Rs.23,281 within two months unless adjusted against arrears.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition accepted; refund of Rs.23,281 directed.
legal_arguments: Petitioner argued that Section 67(2) renders declarations void if tax is paid beyond the prescribed period.
Respondents relied on Section 70, which prohibits tax refunds under any circumstances.
sections: Sections 65, 66, 67, and 70 of Voluntary Disclosure of Income Scheme, 1997
key_issues: Validity of tax declaration under Voluntary Disclosure of Income Scheme, 1997
Applicability of Section 70 to void declarations
Constitutionality of tax retention under Article 265

maxims.Article 265: No tax shall be levied or collected except by authority of law.

legal_terms.Void Declaration: A declaration deemed never to have been made due to non-compliance with statutory requirements.

summary_vector_notes: Petitioner filed a declaration under the Voluntary Disclosure of Income Scheme, 1997, disclosing income for 1991-92 and 1992-93. Tax payment was delayed by one day beyond the prescribed three-month period, rendering the declaration void. Respondents denied refund citing Section 70 of the scheme. The court ruled that retention of tax paid under a void declaration is unconstitutional under Article 265 of the Constitution. Refund of Rs.23,281 was directed within two months unless adjusted against arrears.
